name: Acceptance Criteria - All site personnel inducted (includes environment and cultural). Required Safe Work Method Statements completed and signed. Subcontractor’s safety plan/procedure approved.

Acceptance Criteria - Installation of soil erosion and sedimentation controls completed in accordance with Soil and Water Specs. Air quality to be visually monitored for dust etc. as a direct result of construction activities.

Acceptance Criteria - Remove or mask immediately before or after placement of new markings. Make sure the surface is clean, undamaged with surface texture, reflectivity characteristics and colour comparable to the adjacent pavement surface.

• For temporary masking use black non-reflective masking tapes with skid resistance properties. Methods of application: Submit method of application of materials and methods to protect the work from premature trafficking.
• Removal of redundant markings: Submit details of method for removing redundant pavement markings, at least 24 hours before the removal of markings. (HP)
Acceptance Criteria - If marking tape is required, submit samples and product details at least 5 days prior to material ordering and delivery.  (HP)
Acceptance Criteria - Road pavement marking: For longitudinal lines, conform to the following:
o White and/or yellow road marking paint
o White and/or yellow thermoplastic or cold applied plastic material
o For waterborne paint: To AS 4049.3
o Solvent-borne paint: Do not use without prior approval, conform to AS 4049.1.
• Anti-skid pavement markings: Angular, polishing resistant particles which provide skid resistance. Apply anti-skid media, if the skid resistance on the existing is less than 45 BPN or equivalent.
o Colour: compatible with marking colour
o Transverse lines and other markings: 0.4 to 0.7 mm
o Anti-skid material application rate: Minimum 0.20 k/m2.
• For Non-profile thermoplastic pavement marking material:
o Longitudinal line markings: Sprayed or extruded thermoplastics applied uniformly.
o Transverse lines and other markings: If required, screed thermoplastic material using a mobile applicator and templates to control the pattern – Thickness: 3mm ± 1mm.
• Two-part cold applied plastic pavement marking material: Measured at 23°C and to AS 1580.401.8
o For trowel or screed applied material (containing intermix glass beads): Maximum 20 minutes for 2.0 ± 0.25 mm applied film thickness.
o For spray material (not containing glass beads): Maximum 5 minutes for 0.200 ± 0.025 mm applied film thickness.
o Longitudinal line marking: Sprayed material
o Application rates for two-part cold applied pavement materials and glass beads table:
Material || Longitudinal linemarking: Sprayed application || Transverse lines and other markings: Trowelled, screeded or extruded || Transverse lines and other markings: Sprayed
Cold applied material thickness (excluding surface applied beads) || 0.5 ± 0.05 mm (wet) || 2.0 ± 0.2 mm (dry) || 1.00 ± 0.1 mm (wet)
– Type (AS/NZS 2009) || Type D-HR (adhesive coated) || Type B || Type B
– Rate retained in the painted surface || ≥ 400 g/m2 || ≥ 300 g/m2 || ≥ 300 g/m2
* Glass beads coated with a compatible coupling agent for an improved adhesive bond with thermoplastic or two-part cold applied road marking material.
o Bead type: B-HR, C-HR or D-HR
o Incorporate glass beads in thermoplastic material in the proportion of a minimum 20% of total mass
o Type B glass beads rate: Minimum 0.30 kg/m2
o Type D-HR glass beads: Minimum 0.50kg/m2
Raised Pavement Markers: Reflective and non-reflective markers to AS/NZS 1906.3
o Hot melt bitumen adhesive to wearing surface
o Application: To the manufacturer’s recommendations.
o Removal: If required, remove to the manufacturer’s recommendations.

• Material properties: Submit test reports from a registered laboratory verifying material property conformance, including for paint, glass beads, raised pavement markers and thermoplastic material. (HP)
• Test currency: Not older than 3 years.
• Quality verification: If material/product quality verification can be obtained from the supplier, documented tests need not be repeated.
Acceptance Criteria - Setting out: Completion of pavement marking set-out, at least 5 days prior to marking application. (HP)
Acceptance Criteria - Surface preparation: Completes surface preparation, before applying pavement markings, at least 1 day prior to marking application. (HP)
Acceptance Criteria - Completion: Completed pavement marking, at least 1 day before inspection. (HP)
